member.name: T:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers
member.summary: Provides support for common .NET types that do not have a direct representation in protobuf, using the definitions from bcl.proto

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.GetUninitializedObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified type, bypassing the constructor.
member.param: The type to create
member.returns: The new instance
member.exception: If the platform does not support constructor-skipping

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.WriteTimeSpan(System.TimeSpan,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a TimeSpan to a protobuf stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.ReadTimeSpan(ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Parses a TimeSpan from a protobuf stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.ReadDateTime(ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Parses a DateTime from a protobuf stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.WriteDateTime(System.DateTime,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a DateTime to a protobuf stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.ReadDecimal(ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Parses a decimal from a protobuf stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.WriteDecimal(System.Decimal,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a decimal to a protobuf stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.WriteGuid(System.Guid,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a Guid to a protobuf stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.ReadGuid(ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Parses a Guid from a protobuf stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.ReadNetObject(System.Object,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader,System.Int32,System.Type,ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.NetObjectOptions)
member.summary: Reads an *implementation specific* bundled .NET object, including (as options) type-metadata, identity/re-use, etc.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.WriteNetObject(System.Object,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.NetObjectOptions)
member.summary: Writes an *implementation specific* bundled .NET object, including (as options) type-metadata, identity/re-use, etc.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.NetObjectOptions
member.summary: Optional behaviours that introduce .NET-specific functionality

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.NetObjectOptions.None
member.summary: No special behaviour

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.NetObjectOptions.AsReference
member.summary: Enables full object-tracking/full-graph support.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.NetObjectOptions.DynamicType
member.summary: Embeds the type information into the stream, allowing usage with types not known in advance.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.BclHelpers.NetObjectOptions.UseConstructor
member.summary: If false, the constructor for the type is bypassed during deserialization, meaning any field initializers or other initialization code is skipped.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.BufferExtension
member.summary: Provides a simple buffer-based implementation of an extension object.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.IExtension
member.summary: Provides addition capability for supporting unexpected fields during protocol-buffer serialization/deserialization. This allows for loss-less round-trip/merge, even when the data is not fully understood.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.BeginAppend
member.summary: Requests a stream into which any unexpected fields can be persisted.
member.returns: A new stream suitable for storing data.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.EndAppend(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates that all unexpected fields have now been stored. The implementing class is responsible for closing the stream. If "commit" is not true the data may be discarded.
member.param: The stream originally obtained by BeginAppend.
True if the append operation completed successfully.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.BeginQuery
member.summary: Requests a stream of the unexpected fields previously stored.
member.returns: A prepared stream of the unexpected fields.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.EndQuery(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Indicates that all unexpected fields have now been read. The implementing class is responsible for closing the stream.
member.param: The stream originally obtained by BeginQuery.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtension.GetLength
member.summary: Requests the length of the raw binary stream; this is used when serializing sub-entities to indicate the expected size.
member.returns: The length of the binary stream representing unexpected data.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoBeforeSerializationAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a method on the root-contract in an hierarchy to be invoked before serialization.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoAfterSerializationAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a method on the root-contract in an hierarchy to be invoked after serialization.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoBeforeDeserializationAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a method on the root-contract in an hierarchy to be invoked before deserialization.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoAfterDeserializationAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a method on the root-contract in an hierarchy to be invoked after deserialization.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.DataFormat
member.summary: Sub-format to use when serializing/deserializing data

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.Default
member.summary: Uses the default encoding for the data-type.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.ZigZag
member.summary: When applied to signed integer-based data (including Decimal), this indicates that zigzag variant encoding will be used. This means that values with small magnitude (regardless of sign) take a small amount of space to encode.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.TwosComplement
member.summary: When applied to signed integer-based data (including Decimal), this indicates that two's-complement variant encoding will be used. This means that any -ve number will take 10 bytes (even for 32-bit), so should only be used for compatibility.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.FixedSize
member.summary: When applied to signed integer-based data (including Decimal), this indicates that a fixed amount of space will be used.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.DataFormat.Group
member.summary: When applied to a sub-message, indicates that the value should be treated as group-delimited.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ExtensibleUtil
member.summary: This class acts as an internal wrapper allowing us to do a dynamic methodinfo invoke; an't put into Serializer as don't want on public API; can't put into Serializer<T> since we need to invoke accross classes, which isn't allowed in Silverlight)

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ExtensibleUtil.GetExtendedValues``1(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.DataFormat,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
M:ProtoBuf.ExtensibleUtil.GetExtendedValuesTyped``2(``0,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.DataFormat,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads the given value(s) from the instance's stream; the serializer is inferred from TValue and format. For singletons, each occurrence is merged [only applies for sub-objects], and the composed value if yielded once; otherwise ("repeated") each occurrence is yielded separately.
member.remarks: Needs to be public to be callable thru reflection in Silverlight

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ExtensibleUtil.AppendExtendValueTyped``2(ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel,``0,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.DataFormat,``1)
member.summary: Stores the given value into the instance's stream; the serializer is inferred from TValue and format.
member.remarks: Needs to be public to be callable thru reflection in Silverlight

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Helpers
member.summary: Not all frameworks are created equal (fx1.1 vs fx2.0, micro-framework, compact-framework, silverlight, etc). This class simply wraps up a few things that would otherwise make the real code unnecessarily messy, providing fallback implementations if necessary.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoTypeCode
member.summary: Intended to be a direct map to regular TypeCode, but: - with missing types - existing on WinRT

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.IExtensible
member.summary: Indicates that the implementing type has support for protocol-buffer extensions.
member.remarks: Can be implemented by deriving from .

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.IExtensible.GetExtensionObject(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the extension object for the current instance, optionally creating it if it does not already exist.
member.param: Should a new extension object be created if it does not already exist?
member.returns: The extension object if it exists (or was created), or null if the extension object does not exist or is not available.
member.remarks: The createIfMissing argument is false during serialization, and true during deserialization upon encountering unexpected fields.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ImplicitFields
member.summary: Specifies the method used to infer field tags for members of the type under consideration. Tags are deduced using the invariant alphabetic sequence of the members' names; this makes implicit field tags very brittle, and susceptible to changes such as field names (normally an isolated change).

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.ImplicitFields.None
member.summary: No members are serialized implicitly; all members require a suitable attribute such as [ProtoMember]. This is the recmomended mode for most scenarios.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.ImplicitFields.AllPublic
member.summary: Public properties and fields are eligible for implicit serialization; this treats the public API as a contract. Ordering beings from ImplicitFirstTag.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.ImplicitFields.AllFields
member.summary: Public and non-public fields are eligible for implicit serialization; this acts as a state/implementation serializer. Ordering beings from ImplicitFirstTag.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments needed to perform type-formatting functions; this could be resolving a Type to a string suitable for serialization, or could be requesting a Type from a string. If no changes are made, a default implementation will be used (from the assembly-qualified names).

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs.Type
member.summary: The type involved in this map; if this is initially null, a Type is expected to be provided for the string in FormattedName.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs.FormattedName
member.summary: The formatted-name involved in this map; if this is initially null, a formatted-name is expected from the type in Type.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate type used to perform type-formatting functions; the sender originates as the type-model.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel
member.summary: Provides protobuf serialization support for a number of types

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.TrySerializeAuxiliaryType(ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter,System.Type,ProtoBuf.DataFormat,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This is the more "complete" version of Serialize, which handles single instances of mapped types. The value is written as a complete field, including field-header and (for sub-objects) a length-prefix In addition to that, this provides support for: - basic values; individual int / string / Guid / etc - IEnumerable sequences of any type handled by TrySerializeAuxiliaryType

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.Serialize(System.IO.Stream,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes a protocol-buffer representation of the given instance to the supplied stream.
member.param: The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
The destination stream to write to.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.Serialize(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext)
member.summary: Writes a protocol-buffer representation of the given instance to the supplied stream.
member.param: The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
The destination stream to write to.
Additional information about this serialization operation.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeWithLengthPrefix(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (or null), using length-prefixed data - useful with network IO.
member.param: The type being merged.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeWithLengthPrefix(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.Serializer.TypeResolver)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (or null), using length-prefixed data - useful with network IO.
member.param: The type being merged.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).
Used to resolve types on a per-field basis.
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeWithLengthPrefix(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.Serializer.TypeResolver,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (or null), using length-prefixed data - useful with network IO.
member.param: The type being merged.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).
Used to resolve types on a per-field basis.
Returns the number of bytes consumed by this operation (includes length-prefix overheads and any skipped data).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeItems(System.IO.Stream,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.Serializer.TypeResolver)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
On a field-by-field basis, the type of object to deserialize (can be null if "type" is specified).
The type of object to deserialize (can be null if "resolver" is specified).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeItems(System.IO.Stream,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.Serializer.TypeResolver,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
On a field-by-field basis, the type of object to deserialize (can be null if "type" is specified).
The type of object to deserialize (can be null if "resolver" is specified).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.
member.param: Additional information about this serialization operation.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeItems``1(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.typeparam: The type of object to deserialize.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeItems``1(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.typeparam: The type of object to deserialize.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.
member.param: Additional information about this serialization operation.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.SerializeWithLengthPrefix(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a protocol-buffer representation of the given instance to the supplied stream, with a length-prefix. This is useful for socket programming, as DeserializeWithLengthPrefix can be used to read the single object back from an ongoing stream.
member.param: The type being serialized.
The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The destination stream to write to.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.SerializeWithLengthPrefix(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext)
member.summary: Writes a protocol-buffer representation of the given instance to the supplied stream, with a length-prefix. This is useful for socket programming, as DeserializeWithLengthPrefix can be used to read the single object back from an ongoing stream.
member.param: The type being serialized.
The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The destination stream to write to.
The tag used as a prefix to each record (only used with base-128 style prefixes).
Additional information about this serialization operation.

member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (which may be null).
member.param: The type (including inheritance) to consider.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.Deserialize(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,System.Type,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (which may be null).
member.param: The type (including inheritance) to consider.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.
member.param: Additional information about this serialization operation.

member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (which may be null).
member.param: The type (including inheritance) to consider.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
The number of bytes to consume.
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.Deserialize(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,System.Type,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (which may be null).
member.param: The type (including inheritance) to consider.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
The number of bytes to consume (or -1 to read to the end of the stream).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.
member.param: Additional information about this serialization operation.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.TryDeserializeAuxiliaryType(ProtoBuf.ProtoReader,ProtoBuf.DataFormat,System.Int32,System.Type,System.Object@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This is the more "complete" version of Deserialize, which handles single instances of mapped types. The value is read as a complete field, including field-header and (for sub-objects) a length-prefix..kmc
In addition to that, this provides support for: - basic values; individual int / string / Guid / etc - IList sets of any type handled by TryDeserializeAuxiliaryType

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.ResolveProxies(System.Type)
member.summary: Applies common proxy scenarios, resolving the actual type to consider

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.IsDefined(System.Type)
member.summary: Indicates whether the supplied type is explicitly modelled by the model

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.GetKey(System.Type@)
member.summary: Provides the key that represents a given type in the current model. The type is also normalized for proxies at the same time.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.GetKeyImpl(System.Type)
member.summary: Provides the key that represents a given type in the current model.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.Serialize(System.Int32,System.Object,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a protocol-buffer representation of the given instance to the supplied stream.
member.param: Represents the type (including inheritance) to consider.
The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
The destination stream to write to.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.Deserialize(System.Int32,System.Object,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (which may be null).
member.param: Represents the type (including inheritance) to consider.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeepClone(System.Object)
member.summary: Create a deep clone of the supplied instance; any sub-items are also cloned.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.ThrowUnexpectedSubtype(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Indicates that while an inheritance tree exists, the exact type encountered was not specified in that hierarchy and cannot be processed.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.ThrowUnexpectedType(System.Type)
member.summary: Indicates that the given type was not expected, and cannot be processed.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.ThrowCannotCreateInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Indicates that the given type cannot be constructed; it may still be possible to deserialize into existing instances.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.CanSerializeContractType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns true if the type supplied is either a recognised contract type, or a *list* of a recognised contract type.
member.remarks: Note that primitives always return false, even though the engine will, if forced, try to serialize such
member.returns: True if this type is recognised as a serializable entity, else false

member.name: E:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DynamicTypeFormatting
member.summary: Used to provide custom services for writing and parsing type names when using dynamic types. Both parsing and formatting are provided on a single API as it is essential that both are mapped identically at all times.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.CallbackType
member.summary: Indicates the type of callback to be used

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.CallbackType.BeforeSerialize
member.summary: Invoked before an object is serialized

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.CallbackType.AfterSerialize
member.summary: Invoked after an object is serialized

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.CallbackType.BeforeDeserialize
member.summary: Invoked before an object is deserialized (or when a new instance is created)

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.CallbackType.AfterDeserialize
member.summary: Invoked after an object is deserialized

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle
member.summary: Specifies the type of prefix that should be applied to messages.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle.None
member.summary: No length prefix is applied to the data; the data is terminated only be the end of the stream.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle.Base128
member.summary: A base-128 length prefix is applied to the data (efficient for short messages).

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle.Fixed32
member.summary: A fixed-length (little-endian) length prefix is applied to the data (useful for compatibility).

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle.Fixed32BigEndian
member.summary: A fixed-length (big-endian) length prefix is applied to the data (useful for compatibility).

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a type is defined for protocol-buffer serialization.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined name of the type.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.ImplicitFirstTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the fist offset to use with implicit field tags; only uesd if ImplicitFields is set.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.UseProtoMembersOnly
member.summary: If specified, alternative contract markers (such as markers for XmlSerailizer or DataContractSerializer) are ignored.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.IgnoreListHandling
member.summary: If specified, do NOT treat this type as a list, even if it looks like one.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.ImplicitFields
member.summary: Gets or sets the mechanism used to automatically infer field tags for members. This option should be used in advanced scenarios only. Please review the important notes against the ImplicitFields enumeration.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.InferTagFromName
member.summary: Enables/disables automatic tag generation based on the existing name / order of the defined members. This option is not used for members marked with ProtoMemberAttribute, as intended to provide compatibility with WCF serialization. WARNING: when adding new fields you must take care to increase the Order for new elements, otherwise data corruption may occur.
member.remarks: If not explicitly specified, the default is assumed from .

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.InferTagFromNameHasValue
member.summary: Has a InferTagFromName value been explicitly set? if not, the default from the type-model is assumed.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.DataMemberOffset
member.summary:
Specifies an offset to apply to [DataMember(Order=...)] markers; this is useful when working with mex-generated classes that have a different origin (usually 1 vs 0) than the original data-contract.
This value is added to the Order of each member.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.SkipConstructor
member.summary: If true, the constructor for the type is bypassed during deserialization, meaning any field initializers or other initialization code is skipped.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoEnumAttribute
member.summary: Used to define protocol-buffer specific behavior for enumerated values.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoEnumAttribute.HasValue
member.summary: Indicates whether this instance has a customised value mapping
member.returns: true if a specific value is set

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoEnumAttribute.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific value to use for this enum during serialization.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoEnumAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined name of the enum, as used in .proto (this name is not used during serialization).

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoException
member.summary: Indicates an error during serialization/deserialization of a proto stream.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoException.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new ProtoException instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ProtoException instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates a new ProtoException instance.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoIgnoreAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a member should be excluded from serialization; this is only normally used when using implict fields.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoPartialIgnoreAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a member should be excluded from serialization; this is only normally used when using implict fields. This allows ProtoIgnoreAttribute usage even for partial classes where the individual members are not under direct control.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoPartialIgnoreAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ProtoPartialIgnoreAttribute instance.
member.param: Specifies the member to be ignored.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoPartialIgnoreAttribute.MemberName
member.summary: The name of the member to be ignored.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoIncludeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the known-types to support for an individual message. This serializes each level in the hierarchy as a nested message to retain wire-compatibility with other protocol-buffer implementations.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoIncludeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Type)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the ProtoIncludeAttribute.
member.param: The unique index (within the type) that will identify this data.
The additional type to serialize/deserialize.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoIncludeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the ProtoIncludeAttribute.
member.param: The unique index (within the type) that will identify this data.
The additional type to serialize/deserialize.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoIncludeAttribute.Tag
member.summary: Gets the unique index (within the type) that will identify this data.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoIncludeAttribute.KnownTypeName
member.summary: Gets the additional type to serialize/deserialize.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoIncludeAttribute.KnownType
member.summary: Gets the additional type to serialize/deserialize.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoIncludeAttribute.DataFormat
member.summary: Specifies whether the inherited sype's sub-message should be written with a length-prefix (default), or with group markers.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute
member.summary: Declares a member to be used in protocol-buffer serialization, using the given Tag. A DataFormat may be used to optimise the serialization format (for instance, using zigzag encoding for negative numbers, or fixed-length encoding for large values.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compare with another ProtoMemberAttribute for sorting purposes

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.CompareTo(ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute)
member.summary: Compare with another ProtoMemberAttribute for sorting purposes

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new ProtoMemberAttribute instance.
member.param: Specifies the unique tag used to identify this member within the type.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the original name defined in the .proto; not used during serialization.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.DataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the data-format to be used when encoding this value.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.Tag
member.summary: Gets the unique tag used to identify this member within the type.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.IsRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this member is mandatory.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.IsPacked
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this member is packed. This option only applies to list/array data of primitive types (int, double, etc).

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.OverwriteList
member.summary: Indicates whether this field should *repace* existing values (the default is false, meaning *append*). This option only applies to list/array data.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.AsReference
member.summary: Enables full object-tracking/full-graph support.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.DynamicType
member.summary: Embeds the type information into the stream, allowing usage with types not known in advance.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoMemberAttribute.Options
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this member is packed (lists/arrays).

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.MemberSerializationOptions
member.summary: Additional (optional) settings that control serialization of members

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.MemberSerializationOptions.None
member.summary: Default; no additional options

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.MemberSerializationOptions.Packed
member.summary: Indicates that repeated elements should use packed (length-prefixed) encoding

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.MemberSerializationOptions.Required
member.summary: Indicates that the given item is required

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.MemberSerializationOptions.AsReference
member.summary: Enables full object-tracking/full-graph support

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.MemberSerializationOptions.DynamicType
member.summary: Embeds the type information into the stream, allowing usage with types not known in advance

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.MemberSerializationOptions.OverwriteList
member.summary: Indicates whether this field should *repace* existing values (the default is false, meaning *append*). This option only applies to list/array data.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoPartialMemberAttribute
member.summary: Declares a member to be used in protocol-buffer serialization, using the given Tag and MemberName. This allows ProtoMemberAttribute usage even for partial classes where the individual members are not under direct control. A DataFormat may be used to optimise the serialization format (for instance, using zigzag encoding for negative numbers, or fixed-length encoding for large values.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoPartialMemberAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ProtoMemberAttribute instance.
member.param: Specifies the unique tag used to identify this member within the type.
Specifies the member to be serialized.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoPartialMemberAttribute.MemberName
member.summary: The name of the member to be serialized.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader
member.summary: A stateful reader, used to read a protobuf stream. Typical usage would be (sequentially) to call ReadFieldHeader and (after matching the field) an appropriate Read* method.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext)
member.summary: Creates a new reader against a stream
member.param: The source stream
The model to use for serialization; this can be null, but this will impair the ability to deserialize sub-objects
Additional context about this serialization operation

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new reader against a stream
member.param: The source stream
The model to use for serialization; this can be null, but this will impair the ability to deserialize sub-objects
Additional context about this serialization operation
The number of bytes to read, or -1 to read until the end of the stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Dispose
member.summary: Releases resources used by the reader, but importantly does not Dispose the underlying stream; in many typical use-cases the stream is used for different processes, so it is assumed that the consumer will Dispose their stream separately.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadUInt32
member.summary: Reads an unsigned 32-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadInt16
member.summary: Reads a signed 16-bit integer from the stream: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadUInt16
member.summary: Reads an unsigned 16-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads an unsigned 8-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadSByte
member.summary: Reads a signed 8-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadInt32
member.summary: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadInt64
member.summary: Reads a signed 64-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a string from the stream (using UTF8); supported wire-types: String

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ThrowEnumException(System.Type,System.Int32)
member.summary: Throws an exception indication that the given value cannot be mapped to an enum.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadDouble
member.summary: Reads a double-precision number from the stream; supported wire-types: Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadObject(System.Object,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Reads (merges) a sub-message from the stream, internally calling StartSubItem and EndSubItem, and (in between) parsing the message in accordance with the model associated with the reader

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.EndSubItem(ProtoBuf.SubItemToken,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Makes the end of consuming a nested message in the stream; the stream must be either at the correct EndGroup marker, or all fields of the sub-message must have been consumed (in either case, this means ReadFieldHeader should return zero)

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.StartSubItem(ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Begins consuming a nested message in the stream; supported wire-types: StartGroup, String
member.remarks: The token returned must be help and used when callining EndSubItem

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadFieldHeader
member.summary: Reads a field header from the stream, setting the wire-type and retuning the field number. If no more fields are available, then 0 is returned. This methods respects sub-messages.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.TryReadFieldHeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Looks ahead to see whether the next field in the stream is what we expect (typically; what we've just finished reading - for example ot read successive list items)

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Hint(ProtoBuf.WireType)
member.summary: Compares the streams current wire-type to the hinted wire-type, updating the reader if necessary; for example, a Variant may be updated to SignedVariant. If the hinted wire-type is unrelated then no change is made.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Assert(ProtoBuf.WireType)
member.summary: Verifies that the stream's current wire-type is as expected, or a specialized sub-type (for example, SignedVariant) - in which case the current wire-type is updated. Otherwise an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.SkipField
member.summary: Discards the data for the current field.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadUInt64
member.summary: Reads an unsigned 64-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadSingle
member.summary: Reads a single-precision number from the stream; supported wire-types: Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadBoolean
member.summary: Reads a boolean value from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.AppendBytes(System.Byte[],ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Reads a byte-sequence from the stream, appending them to an existing byte-sequence (which can be null); supported wire-types: String

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadLengthPrefix(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads the length-prefix of a message from a stream without buffering additional data, allowing a fixed-length reader to be created.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.DirectReadLittleEndianInt32(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a little-endian encoded integer. An exception is thrown if the data is not all available.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.DirectReadBigEndianInt32(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a big-endian encoded integer. An exception is thrown if the data is not all available.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.DirectReadVarintInt32(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a varint encoded integer. An exception is thrown if the data is not all available.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.DirectReadBytes(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a string (of a given lenth, in bytes) directly from the source into a pre-existing buffer. An exception is thrown if the data is not all available.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.DirectReadBytes(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a given number of bytes directly from the source. An exception is thrown if the data is not all available.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.DirectReadString(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a string (of a given lenth, in bytes) directly from the source. An exception is thrown if the data is not all available.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadLengthPrefix(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads the length-prefix of a message from a stream without buffering additional data, allowing a fixed-length reader to be created.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.TryReadUInt32Variant(System.IO.Stream,System.UInt32@)
member.returns: The number of bytes consumed; 0 if no data available

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.AppendExtensionData(ProtoBuf.IExtensible)
member.summary: Copies the current field into the instance as extension data

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.HasSubValue(ProtoBuf.WireType,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Indicates whether the reader still has data remaining in the current sub-item, additionally setting the wire-type for the next field if there is more data. This is used when decoding packed data.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.NoteObject(System.Object,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Utility method, not intended for public use; this helps maintain the root object is complex scenarios

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.FieldNumber
member.summary: Gets the number of the field being processed.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.WireType
member.summary: Indicates the underlying proto serialization format on the wire.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Context
member.summary: Addition information about this deserialization operation.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Position
member.summary: Returns the position of the current reader (note that this is not necessarily the same as the position in the underlying stream, if multiple readers are used on the same stream)

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter
member.summary:
Represents an output stream for writing protobuf data.
Why is the API backwards (static methods with writer arguments)? See: http://marcgravell.blogspot.com/2010/03/last-will-be-first-and-first-will-be.html

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteObject(System.Object,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Write an encapsulated sub-object, using the supplied unique key (reprasenting a type).
member.param: The object to write.
The key that uniquely identifies the type within the model.
The destination.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteRecursionSafeObject(System.Object,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Write an encapsulated sub-object, using the supplied unique key (reprasenting a type) - but the caller is asserting that this relationship is non-recursive; no recursion check will be performed.
member.param: The object to write.
The key that uniquely identifies the type within the model.
The destination.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteFieldHeader(System.Int32,ProtoBuf.WireType,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a field-header, indicating the format of the next data we plan to write.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteBytes(System.Byte[],ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a byte-array to the stream; supported wire-types: String

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a byte-array to the stream; supported wire-types: String

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.StartSubItem(System.Object,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Indicates the start of a nested record.
member.param: The instance to write.
The destination.
member.returns: A token representing the state of the stream; this token is given to EndSubItem.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.EndSubItem(ProtoBuf.SubItemToken,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Indicates the end of a nested record.
member.param: The token obtained from StartubItem.
The destination.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel,ProtoBuf.SerializationContext)
member.summary: Creates a new writer against a stream
member.param: The destination stream
The model to use for serialization; this can be null, but this will impair the ability to serialize sub-objects
Additional context about this serialization operation

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.Close
member.summary: Flushes data to the underlying stream, and releases any resources. The underlying stream is *not* disposed by this operation.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.Flush(ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes any buffered data (if possible) to the underlying stream.
member.param: The writer to flush
member.remarks: It is not always possible to fully flush, since some sequences may require values to be back-filled into the byte-stream.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteUInt32Variant(System.UInt32,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes an unsigned 32-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteString(System.String,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a string to the stream; supported wire-types: String

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteUInt64(System.UInt64,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes an unsigned 64-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteInt64(System.Int64,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a signed 64-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteUInt32(System.UInt32,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes an unsigned 16-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteInt16(System.Int16,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a signed 16-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteUInt16(System.UInt16,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes an unsigned 16-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteByte(System.Byte,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes an unsigned 8-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteSByte(System.SByte,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a signed 8-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteInt32(System.Int32,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a signed 32-bit integer to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteDouble(System.Double,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a double-precision number to the stream; supported wire-types: Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteSingle(System.Single,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a single-precision number to the stream; supported wire-types: Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.ThrowEnumException(ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter,System.Object)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating that the given enum cannot be mapped to a serialized value.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.WriteBoolean(System.Boolean,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Writes a boolean to the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.AppendExtensionData(ProtoBuf.IExtensible,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Copies any extension data stored for the instance to the underlying stream

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.SetPackedField(System.Int32,ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter)
member.summary: Used for packed encoding; indicates that the next field should be skipped rather than a field header written. Note that the field number must match, else an exception is thrown when the attempt is made to write the (incorrect) field. The wire-type is taken from the subsequent call to WriteFieldHeader. Only primitive types can be packed.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.SetRootObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Specifies a known root object to use during reference-tracked serialization

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoWriter.Context
member.summary: Addition information about this serialization operation.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.SerializationContext
member.summary: Additional information about a serialization operation

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.SerializationContext.Context
member.summary: Gets or sets a user-defined object containing additional information about this serialization/deserialization operation.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.SerializationContext.Default
member.summary: A default SerializationContext, with minimal information.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Serializer
member.summary: Provides protocol-buffer serialization capability for concrete, attributed types. This is a *default* model, but custom serializer models are also supported.
member.remarks: Protocol-buffer serialization is a compact binary format, designed to take advantage of sparse data and knowledge of specific data types; it is also extensible, allowing a type to be deserialized / merged even if some data is not recognised.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.Serializer.ListItemTag
member.summary: The field number that is used as a default when serializing/deserializing a list of objects. The data is treated as repeated message with field number 1.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.FlushPool
member.summary: Releases any internal buffers that have been reserved for efficiency; this does not affect any serialization operations; simply: it can be used (optionally) to release the buffers for garbage collection (at the expense of having to re-allocate a new buffer for the next operation, rather than re-use prior buffers).

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Serializer.TypeResolver
member.summary: Maps a field-number to a type

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.SubItemToken
member.summary: Used to hold particulars relating to nested objects. This is opaque to the caller - simply give back the token you are given at the end of an object.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.WireType
member.summary: Indicates the encoding used to represent an individual value in a protobuf stream

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.WireType.None
member.summary: Represents an error condition

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.WireType.Variant
member.summary: Base-128 variant-length encoding

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.WireType.Fixed64
member.summary: Fixed-length 8-byte encoding

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.WireType.String
member.summary: Length-variant-prefixed encoding

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.WireType.StartGroup
member.summary: Indicates the start of a group

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.WireType.EndGroup
member.summary: Indicates the end of a group

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.WireType.SignedVariant
member.summary: This is not a formal wire-type in the "protocol buffers" spec, but denotes a variant integer that should be interpreted using zig-zag semantics (so -ve numbers aren't a significant overhead)
